Removed one insert statement from file states_inserts_statements_without_parent_code.sql having state name as Rangpur as it is a duplicate record having all column values completely identical as shown below. 

*Insert statements:*
INSERT INTO states (state_id,  created_by,  created_date,  last_updated_by,  last_updated_date,  is_active, place_type_name,  state_code,  state_name,  country_id,  selectable,  parent_state_id,  language_code, romanization_system_id,  state_code_id, language_id) VALUES (nextval('states_state_id_seq'), 'flyway', now(), 'flyway', now(), False, 'division', 'F', 'Rangpur', (select country_id from countries where country_code = 'BD'), True, NULL, 'bn', NULL, (SELECT state_code_id FROM state_codes WHERE country_id = (SELECT country_id from countries where country_code = 'BD') AND state_code = 'F') , (select language_id from languages where language_code = 'bn'));

INSERT INTO states (state_id,  created_by,  created_date,  last_updated_by,  last_updated_date,  is_active, place_type_name,  state_code,  state_name,  country_id,  selectable,  parent_state_id,  language_code, romanization_system_id,  state_code_id, language_id) VALUES (nextval('states_state_id_seq'), 'flyway', now(), 'flyway', now(), False, 'division', 'F', 'Rangpur', (select country_id from countries where country_code = 'BD'), True, NULL, 'bn', NULL, (SELECT state_code_id FROM state_codes WHERE country_id = (SELECT country_id from countries where country_code = 'BD') AND state_code = 'F') , (select language_id from languages where language_code = 'bn')); 

*Data in input file from DB dump:*

COPY public.states (state_id, created_by, created_date, last_updated_by, last_updated_date, is_active, place_type_name, state_code, state_name, country_id, selectable, parent_state_id, language_code, romanization_system_id, state_code_id, language_id) FROM stdin;
3597	SYSTEM	2014-02-26 21:14:18.600773	\N	\N	f	division	F	Rangpur	94	t	\N	bn	\N	1794	8
4581	SYSTEM	2014-02-26 21:14:20.180604	\N	\N	f	division	F	Rangpur	94	t	\N	bn	\N	1794	8

|*state_id*|*created_by*|*created_date*|*last_updated_by*|*last_updated_date*|*is_active*|*place_type_name*|*state_code*|*state_name*|*country_id*|*selectable*|*parent_state_id*|*language_code*|*romanization_system_id*|*state_code_id*|*language_id*|
|*3597*|SYSTEM|2014-02-26 21:14:18.600773| | |0|division|F|Rangpur|94|1| |bn| |1794|8|
|*4581*|SYSTEM|2014-02-26 21:14:20.180604| | |0|division|F|Rangpur|94|1| |bn| |1794|8|

column1: Authentication is not happening on Connect Softphone
column33:
Hello, 

I am facing some issues with my Connect soft phone app. 

Starting on v2.1.6, After introducing my SSO password, it just keeps spinning forever.
Stopped the task, and tried again, same issue, so i decided to uninstall. 

Installed V2.1.3, and the issue keeps going on. Same behavior. after introducing my SSO password, tha wheel keeps spinning.

I have tried switching connection methods (Cable / wifi / Mobile data)

I have also deleted the  Temp files, and %appdata% folder for connect, and the issue persists

During Troubleshooting sesion with Help Desk, we have also downloaded Version 2.1.4 from Company portal with same result. 

On Connect application, I went to View > Toggle Developer options, and see the following error:

:::::::::::::

Error parsing a meta element's content: ';' is not a valid key-value pair separator. Please use ',' instead.
main.js:1 Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONTENT_DECODING_FAILED
require-2.3.6.js:143 Uncaught Error: Script error for "/iawebauth/js/main.js?cachebust=2.21.1.0.42_20240628051335"
[https://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#scripterror|https://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#scripterror|smart-link] 
    at makeError (require-2.3.6.js:168)
    at HTMLScriptElement.onScriptError (require-2.3.6.js:1738)

:::::::::::::

From Developer options, I have cleared application storage from Application tab with no different result
Under same tab, I have deleted the cookies, and still not working. 

I must mention that the web version for soft phone is working correctly, and this application is the only one that is not working from my day to day tools
Thanks in advanced for your kind support

column586:
22/Apr/24 9:34 AM - UTC;62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957;The rpm installation is failing and as per official amazon docs the EPEL repository is not supported on AL2023.


{noformat}[root@ip-10-204-9-87 ~]# dnf search epel-release
Last metadata expiration check: 7:37:54 ago on Mon Apr 22 07:33:33 2024.
No matches found.{noformat}


[https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/ec2-enable-epel|https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/ec2-enable-epel|smart-link] 
[https://docs.aws.amazon.com/linux/al2023/ug/compare-with-al2.html#epel|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/linux/al2023/ug/compare-with-al2.html#epel]

However Amazon Linux 2 is based on Cent OS 7 and supports EPEL repo.
column587:
23/Apr/24 12:47 PM - UTC;62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957;[~accountid:60a2c2f65998a600684d9583] [~accountid:5e555d6bfd328a0c9cecf18f] 
I verified the RPM compatibility with AL2023 instance and the rpm installation is failing as EPEL or EPEL type repository is not supported by AL2023.
So, we won’t be able to install EL6 or EL7 RPMs in AL2023.

We can have the below alternatives:

* Use alternative linux distribution which supports EPEL repo like Rocky os or oracle linux.
* We can use docker to run a centos container and install EPEL inside it to install the  RPMs.
* We can use AL2022 which is based on Centos 7 but the EOL is June 2025.

[~accountid:60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda] Please verify the above 

This time used default tomcat version of Rockyos 9 which is tomcat 9. Manually installing the tomcat 8.5 didn’t work.

Key takeaways:

* Tomcat 9 is the default version for rocky9 OS which is getting installed without any issues, but we need java 11 for it.

column1: Analyze DB solutions in AWS for low volume DB
column33:
Analyze DB solutions in AWS for low volume DB 

Current Size of Address DB is 1GB
column582: 29/May/24 7:14 AM - UTC;60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814;Amazon Aurora Database
column583:
06/Jun/24 4:29 AM - UTC;62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957;Aurora serverless v2 database doesn’t seem to provide any cost optimisation features for storage as needed in our scenario for low volume db.
Instead we are try the below cost optimisation configurations to save costs:

* Start with minimum ACUs as 0.5 to incur lower costs during idle time.
* Temporarily stop the db clusters in test environment as we don’t use the test environment all the time. The db cluster will automatically restart in 7 days , so we can periodically stop it.
column584:
12/Jun/24 9:01 AM - UTC;62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957;[~accountid:60a2c2f65998a600684d9583] Stopping and starting the reader or writer nodes separately is not supported in aurora serverless v2 database. It can only be stopped in cluster level.([https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/aurora-cluster-stop-start.html|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/aurora-cluster-stop-start.html|smart-link] )

If we want to stop the writer instances since that would be rarely be in used we have an option to have mixed configuration in aurora serverless where we can have a provisioned writer node and reader nodes in aurora serverless. This way we can stop the writer node when not needed and reader nodes can keep running.([https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/database/intuits-implementation-of-amazon-aurora-mixed-configuration-cluster-achieving-high-availability-disaster-recovery-and-up-to-55-cost-savings/|https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/database/intuits-implementation-of-amazon-aurora-mixed-configuration-cluster-achieving-high-availability-disaster-recovery-and-up-to-55-cost-savings/|smart-link] )
[https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/database/evaluate-amazon-aurora-serverless-v2-for-your-provisioned-aurora-clusters/|https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/database/evaluate-amazon-aurora-serverless-v2-for-your-provisioned-aurora-clusters/|smart-link]

column33: OPS: Production Deployment
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters

h2. Production

{code:java}apps='address-prod' 
tier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=ord1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=897a7b60ef405677b2157b9eab96aaf5093c6637
rollback_commit=7d64429e900c3f1c4fb0df181934b665714cc47d{code}

h1. Deployment Steps

# On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
# Create your deploy environment.
{code:java}mkdir ADS-504
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-address.git
cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $commit
cd ..{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#ff0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}

# Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code:java}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip{code}
# Execute flyway script against proper database
{code:java}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"{code}
(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code:java}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
#* If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
#** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
#** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
# remove flyway scripts
{code:java}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes

# Run the deploy playbook.
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3{code}

h1. Rollback Steps

# Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code:java}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit{code}
# Re-execute playbook
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3{code}

column1: Fix issues with Address service admin APIs to make it compatible with both v1 & v2 data
column33:
Fix issues with Address service admin APIs to make it compatible with both v1 & v2 data

Below are the known issues:

# Update state API is not working when language_id value in states tables is null. → (Add a null check for state entity - language entity.)
# Update the StateCodeEntity for removing place_type not null constraint ({{@Column(name = "place_type_name", length = PLACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH, nullable = false)}} - remove nullable as false) 



Note : We need to make sure we can create, update and delete data for both v1 & v2 using state code and states Admin APIs.

h2. Requirements
 * Merge tests from AddressService-staging to master

 ** Specify "Production" as the TAGS parameter (default value of job)
OPS: Production Deployment
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters
h2. Production
{code}apps='customer-prod-dr:customer-admin-prod-dr:customer-repose-prod-dr' tier=prodtier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=dfw1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_NEW
rollback_commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_CURRENT
{code}
h1. Deployment Steps
 # On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
 # Create your deploy environment.
{code}mkdir CUST-XXXXX
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-customer.git
cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $commit
cd ..
{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#FF0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}
 # Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
{code}
 # Execute flyway script against proper database
{code}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"
{code}
{quote}(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2
{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
{quote}
 ** If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
 *** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
 *** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
 # remove flyway scripts
{code}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db
{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes
 # Run the deploy playbook.
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3
{code}

h1. Rollback Steps
 # Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit
{code}
 # Re-execute playbook
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3
{code}

column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters

h2. Production

{code:java}apps='address-prod' 
tier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=dfw1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=7d64429e900c3f1c4fb0df181934b665714cc47d
rollback_commit=c9b4ca769b764d99992c97bb11660055cf378282{code}

h1. Deployment Steps

# On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
# Create your deploy environment.
{code:java}mkdir CUST-453
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-address.git
cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $commit
cd ..{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#ff0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}

# Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code:java}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip{code}
# Execute flyway script against proper database
{code:java}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"{code}
(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code:java}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
#* If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
#** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
#** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
# remove flyway scripts
{code:java}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes

# Run the deploy playbook.
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'{code}

h1. Rollback Steps

# Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code:java}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit{code}
# Re-execute playbook
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'{code}

h1. Environment-specific parameters

h2. Staging

{code:java}apps='address' 
tier=staging
toolbox_tier=staging

dc=ord1

commit=c9b4ca769b764d99992c97bb11660055cf378282
rollback_commit=1ee72586c851a387d4ebe185f95cbfecd688a3e8{code}

h2. Test

{code:java}apps='address' 
tier=test
toolbox_tier=staging
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=ord1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_NEW
rollback_commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_CURRENT{code}

h1. Deployment Steps

# On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
# Create your deploy environment.
{code:java}mkdir ADS-421-Actual
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-address.git
cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $commit
cd ..{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#ff0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}

# Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code:java}mkdir address-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/address/address-service-db/${flyway_ver}/address-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip address-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip{code}
# Execute flyway script against proper database
{code:java}AddressServiceDB/bin/address_service_flyway.sh -m -u address_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://address-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/address?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"{code}
(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code:java}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
#* If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
#** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
#** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
# remove flyway scripts
{code:java}cd ../
rm -rf address-db{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes

# Run the deploy playbook.
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet-before-reboot=false'{code}

h1. Rollback Steps

# Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code:java}cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $rollback_commit{code}
# Re-execute playbook
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet-before-reboot=false'{code}

column1: Duplicate State code and States should throw Error
column582:
06/Sep/23 10:38 AM - UTC;62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957;[~accountid:60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814] I think this is not a valid scenario as we can multiple states for a statecode with different language ids but not with same language id. But it should give a bad request in case this is not a valid payload.


[~accountid:60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda] Please confirm.
column583:
06/Sep/23 10:48 AM - UTC;60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda;[~accountid:62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957] [~accountid:60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814] 

I think the {{romanizationSystemId}} should be different in this case.
column584:
07/Sep/23 12:27 PM - UTC;62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957;[~accountid:60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda] Same behaviour as mentioned in this defect is also applicable for state code. If we give two state code values in the payload with same code, then only one of it is getting saved in DB.

Currently we do not have any validation check in place to verify duplicate/invalid states or state code data before saving the data.
I think we should add the below validations for state and state code data provided in the payload:

* Validation to check duplicate state code 
* Validation to check duplicate state with same language
* Validation to check duplicate state with same romanisation system id

Let me know if we need to include any more validations for the same.

column33:
* Make sure state name in the request is Active
* When the Active  and valid state name is provided, it should not be replaced again.
* When only state code is provided, should apply default state name logic for v2 countries.
* Make sure these logic is applied in both Sanity check and resolve state values while preparing the response.

column1: Address Validation logic to support V2 Data Logic
column33:
*/v1/address/validations - API* 

* Make sure state name in the request is Active
* When the state name is active and valid, it should not be replaced again.
* When only state code is provided, should apply default state name logic for v2 countries.
* For V2 countries, If only the state name is provided and multiple state codes exists ,then throw BAD request error.
* Make sure these logic is applied in both Sanity check and resolve state values while preparing the response.
* For V1 countries, the validations should work based on the old logic.

column1: The Client want us to check it should create the notification situation ticket for the redis down issue.
column33:
Hello Team, 

We have specific issue on creating the custom nimbus alert for the redis service, we have tested the monitoring by stopping the REDIS service and could see it has processed alert in internal tools but there were no tickets generated. Could you please check why it is happening, client want us to check it should create the notification situation ticket for the redis down issue.



Received below response from ASOPS team *Incident INC3328270*

----

*2023-06-01 02:05:42 -* [*Lalit Prabhakar Borse*|https://rackspace.service-now.com/sys_user.do?sysparm_view=itil&sysparm_query=user_name=lali1543]^Additional comments^

Hi @Ankush Sethi (anku1480)

We verified the Device(827059) in Event Viewer and we could see that the alert reached RBA and was processed as defined. RBA not sent either a Notification nor created a CORE ticket for the alert as it's not defined for this device (827059).

Unfortunately, we ASOPS don't have access to modify the ARIC process and the Support Automation team owns it. So kindly create SAC JIRA using the below wiki link for them and they would be able to make the change as you requested.

[https://one.rackspace.com/display/support/Support+Account+Customization+Requests|https://one.rackspace.com/display/support/Support+Account+Customization+Requests]

Important note: If you have any questions/clarification kindly click 'Send Comment' after posting your additional comments. This will enable us to pick the ticket for the next course of action. If the issue got resolved then please close this ticket.

***Please be aware that the ticket will be auto-closed after 7 days. So, kindly adhere to the ticket status.***

Looking forward to your valuable comments.

Regards,
Lalit Borse
Team Asops

----

Thanks,
Sandesh Gaonkar

Address scripts testing scenarios for contacts and customer accounts address update:

Contact address update:

# Verify whether the contact is being skipped if no address update is required for the contact.
# Verify if contact is having two addresses and both the address needs to be updated.
# Verify if contact is having two addresses but only one of them needs to updated.
# Verify if state code is updated and not statename and the vice versa, then the address should be updated .
# Verify for single address update scenarios.
# The script should skip address update for the contact by checking the latest status of the contact address before updating even if it is in input list of affected contacts.
# Scripts progress and error needs to be logged.

Customer account address update:

# Verify whether the account is being skipped if no address update is required for the contact.
# Verify if state code is updated and not statename and the vice versa, then the address should be updated
# Verify the address should be updated, if the new state code and name doesn’t match with the current data in account address.
# Scripts progress and error needs to be logged.

column1: Lead list for 2023 Trend Micro+AWS Greenfield ISR campaign
column33:
Hi team, 

Need your help to generate a list with the following criteria + list fields for our Greenfield campaign with Trend Micro and AWS. This campaign will go live the week of May 8. 

* Region - US
* Segment: 
** SMB (accounts spending less than $1000/month billing on AWS) and 
** Enterprise (accounts less than $10,000/month on AWS) 
* Intent: AWS
* Persona: Primary contact at company in SFDC and 2 ITDSM contacts only
* Number of contacts: 3 in total - 1 primary + 2 ITDSM
* AEs: please attach names of existing AEs against the accounts

*List fields*: First name, last name, company name, email, phone number, industry (if applicable), account type (smb or ent), account spend (less than 1,000 or less than 10,000), AE name

*Campaign code*: Q223_NA_Lead-Gen_Intent_Secure-Landing-Zone-Tri-Party-Trend-Micro_AWS_Owned

Thanks so much for your help!

Best,

Savina

column1: Provision/Amend Derrick Crockett derr5952 Amazon Connect Profile
column33:

column33: ADS Release preparation

column1: QE PR: Address Service Data refresh - refactor
column33:
This story is to support both old and new data in Address service.



(Maintain 2 versions. v1 - old/not refreshed country,  v2 - new/refreshed country)

* Add a new column "version" in the table "countries" to maintain the version with value "v1". (column - version)
* Country value is required for any APIs. So,  based on the version we need to follow the old or new logic.
** we need to restore and keep old and new logic.
** we will proceed with the new schema changes without adding constraints which will break old data.
* Any refreshed country will have the version "v2" in the country table that will follow new functionalities.

** we need to restore and keep old and new logic.
** we will proceed with the new schema changes without adding constraints which will break old data.
* Any refreshed country will have the version "v2" in the country table that will follow new functionalities.



+*Implementation details*+

* Restore the database to the version that is in master.
* Add a new column "{{country_version}}" in the table "countries" to maintain the version with value "v1". (column - {{country_version}})
* Have the new database changes that are done. 
* Data has to be migrated in batches.
* Changes has to be done in address-service to make sure the logic works both for v1 data and v2 data.
* Make sure that the changes are very simple so that the v1 logic for data can be removed easily. Have proper deprecated tags and comments.
* Feature flag must be present to control the flow
* Admin APIs will not be used during the migration. But the functionality should work only for v2 countries.

column585:
06/Mar/23 6:34 PM - UTC;60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda;[~accountid:62c4c8ab1bb561c337958957] 

* No version changes in API level
* At any point of time there should be only one version
* Based on the version in the country, it should use old(v1) logic or new (v2) logic. 
* If required, make the query parameters optional and just ignore the query parameter which are not applicable to a version.

column586:
10/Mar/23 7:03 AM - UTC;60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814;[~accountid:60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda] 

* Address Service DB - Master branch has below data files
** V5.3__truncate_data.sql (truncating all data)
** V6.3__load_languages.sql (loading languages)
** V8.3__load_countries.sql (loading new countries)
** V9.3__load_country_language_weightage.sql
** V10.3__load_state_codes_with_no_parent.sql (loading new state codes)
** V11.3__load_state_codes_with_parent.sql (loading new state codes)
** V12.3__load_states.sql (loading new states)
* Do we still have to keep these SQL files - are they still valid, or do we need to modify. what about numbering
* How do we rollback data in staging/test - to master version
* V4.1__language_weightage_tables.sql → apart from new tables, there are lot of changes like columns, constraints… so are these changes still valid for old data ? will these changes support if we have old data.
* V6.1__update_defaults_and_constraints.sql → same for this changes
* Code changes are dependent on flyway changes → so will the new version will it work.

This story needs a deeper discussion on how to handle each of the APIs and the related database changes to define the scope of this story. Post discussion the story description and acceptance criteria needs to be updated.

row number : 38 & 71
AF	NAN*	Nangarhar	NAN	nangarhār	AF	NAN	nangarhār	Nangarhar
AF	NAN*	Nangarhār	NAN	nangarhār	AF	NAN	nangarhār	Nangarhar

Reason for this is the dataframes.drop_duplicates(keep='first', inplace=True) command is only removing the duplicate records in consecutive rows only, but not the records which have same data but has few other records in-between in the table.

In GetContactsForAddressRefresh.py while fetching unique records ({{df2 = df.drop_duplicates(subset=["existing_country_code"], keep=False)}}) it is not providing the expected output.

column1: Dev Defect : get country with includeAllLanguages=false should give state with default language only
column33:
*Currently:*
For a statecode with active states with different languages(one of them is default language entity), 
when we retrieve a country using /v1/admin/countries/\{countryCode}?includeAllLanguages=false
we are not getting any statecode in the response.

and if we include the activeStatesOnly=false param then only we are getting the statecode with states.

*EXPECTED:*

Given : 
An Active Country and an Active State Code with default language entity,
An Active state code has active states with different languages (one of them is default language entity)

When : 
Retrieve a country using /v1/admin/countries/\{countryCode}?includeAllLanguages=false

Then:

column1: Address Compare Country and State names
column33: There is a mismatch in the country names with the old Address service data and the current ISO Data. So, we need to extract the country names and then compare both.
column582:
21/Jun/22 7:23 AM - UTC;60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814;There are total 6000+ state names available. 

There is a challenge to automate the process of verifying the state names and do the comparison.

* The state codes in staging and production are different. 
* For Example in production the state code is BAL* - but in staging, it is BAL
* Some of the state codes are totally new. Like for example, in production it might be B - a single alphabet, now in staging, its two letter code.
* Similarly in production the state code is a number, but in staging its a valid two alphabet code

So, manual intervention is required to validate and match the state codes between production and staging.



Also, the state code names have some special characters. so, its not always like removing the special character and replacing with the corresponding english alphabet. 

Query - if we replace like that, will it be the valid state name according to address doctor.

+*Queries related to address doctor*+

* Special characters are creating a problem in staging. But we tried to upgrade the address doctor version as well in staging. So, which one is actually creating a problem (data or address service version or a combination of both)
* Did we try to check with address doctor team about the issue ? because we are trying to use the latest ISO data. Do they not validating according to latest ISO standard ?
* Is the address doctor - taking into consideration the state name as well ? or only the state code ?



Attached the excel sheet - did the manual comparison for 3000 records.
column583: 23/Jun/22 11:50 AM - UTC;60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814;[~accountid:60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda]  - compared the state code which are in staging to that of production. Out of 6064 entries, 3233 records the state code is not exactly present in production (There are either suffixed with star, or with another state code or its a completely new code). Attached the excel for the reference. ADS-295_State_Name_Comparaision.xls

column33: Code changes
OPS: Test & Staging Deployment
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters

h2. Staging

{code:java}apps='address' 
tier=staging
toolbox_tier=staging
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=ord1
flyway_ver='1.0.4'
commit=cc51704bf96b3f07fa61094a7056e9651b67ea73
rollback_commit=8af73a08a3b4d6e9cd119552ed66f76d499fe053{code}

h1. Deployment Steps

# On *customer-001.$\{toolbox_dc}.$\{toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
# Create your deploy environment.
{code:java}rm -rf ADS-229; mkdir ADS-229
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-address.git
cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $commit
cd ..{code}

h2. Database changes

*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*

# Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code:java}mkdir address-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/address/address-service-db/${flyway_ver}/address-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip address-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip{code}
# Execute flyway script against proper database
{code:java}AddressServiceDB/bin/address_service_flyway.sh -m -u address_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/address?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"{code}
(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code:java}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
#* 
#** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1976|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1976]
#** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1973|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1973]

h2. Deploy app to nodes

# Run the deploy playbook.
{code:java}/usr/bin/ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps} -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'{code}

h1. Rollback Steps

# Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code:java}cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $rollback_commit{code}
# Re-execute playbook
{code:java}/usr/bin/ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps} -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'{code}

column1: Do not allow creating active states under inactive country.
column33:
Currently we are able to create active states under inactive countries with create/update statecode API. This should not be allowed

We don’t have the functionality to add states with create country API. Need to add that as a part of this story.

API : POST v1/admin/countries 

Sample input payload:

{noformat}<country xmlns="http://address-admin.api.rackspace.com/v1" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
code="US" name="UNITED STATES OF AMERICA" 
phonemask="(###) ###-#### x############" 
hasZipCode="true" 
type="Country" active="true">
  <languageWeightages>
    <languageWeightage languageCode="en" weightage="100"/>
    <languageWeightage languageCode="fr" weightage="95"/>
  </languageWeightages>
  <stateCodes>
    <stateCode code="98" type="State" active="true">
      <states>
        <state name="State Name 1" active="true" languageCode="en" romanizationSystemId="32"/>
        <state name="State Name 2" active="true" languageCode="fr" romanizationSystemId="32"/>
      </states>
    </stateCode>
    <stateCode code="99" type="State" active="true">
      <states>
        <state name="State Name 1" active="true" languageCode="en" romanizationSystemId="32"/>
        <state name="State Name 2" active="true" languageCode="fr" romanizationSystemId="32"/>
      </states>
    </stateCode>
  </stateCodes>
</country>{noformat}

This will add language weightages and states to country.
column117:
* Ability to add states with add country API
* Ability to add language weightage with add country API
* All the Validations on states and language weightages should be met
* Inactive states/statecodes should not be allowed to be created for inactive country with create country and create/update state code API.
* Country payload with state codes having parent state code relationship should also work.
column583: 10/Jun/22 11:58 AM - UTC;60a2d03b2614ec0068ae8bf5;[~accountid:60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda] In the current implementation we are not able to create country with state codes. We create a country and then add state codes to it explicitly. Do we want to keep it as it is?

hasZipCode="true"

  </languageWeightages>
  <stateCodes>
    <stateCode code="98" type="State" active="true">
      <states>

        <state name="State Name 2" active="true" languageCode="fr" romanizationSystemId="32"/>

    </stateCode>

  </stateCodes>
</country>{noformat}

column1: [Address v1 contract fix and validate i/p param] QE: Manual Testing
Address v1 contract fix and validate i/p param
column33:
we observed below changes in 2.0.0 staging release. These needs to be fixed before moving to prod.

* There should not be any change in v1 contract in 2.0.0. It should be same as 1.5.7.
** State id should not be provided in get call
** Active should not be displayed in get call if it is true
* Validate I/p params to avoid being processed in repository methods
* Handle transactions correctly.
column117:
1) With the 2.0.0 Latest changes, the V1 API should be exactly same as the previous release, There should not be any changes. This is applicable for below APIs
   - /v1/countries 
   - /v1/countries/{countryCode}
   - /v1/countries/{countryCode}/{stateCode}
2) stateId should not be present in the response for /v1/countries/{country_code} API
3) active should not be present in the response (if they are active) for /v1/countries API - both at country level and states level 
4) stateId should not be present in the response for /v1/countries/{countryCode}/{stateCode} API
5) active should not be present in the response (if they are active) for /v1/countries/{countryCode}/{stateCode} API

column33:
We have created admin APIs for address service with [https://rackspace.atlassian.net/browse/ADS-199|https://rackspace.atlassian.net/browse/ADS-199|smart-link] story. The repose changes for the story has been done so that only admin users can access the Admin APIs.

When non-admin user tries to access the API - it has to throw 403 Forbidden error, but it is currently throwing 404 - Not Found.

We need to identity what additional repose changes has to be done, to get the correct error. (404 is the default response that is given, when the expected role is not there in the request)
column117:
* All the GET Admin APIs need to be secured via repose. The roles required to access is {{edir_admin_role}}
* The Edir Admin Role is specific to the environment.
* When the token does not have the required role, 403 error must be thrown
* When the token is not valid, 401 error must be thrown

column1: When same language is added to country after recreating country, the old value is picked
column33:
Process followed:

*Country created :*

POST : http://address-n02.test.ord1.us.ci.rackspace.net:8080/address/v1/admin/countries/
Payload :
{
  "code": "ZZ",
  "hasZipCode": true,
  "name": "Test Country",
  "active": true,
  "type": "Country",
  "phonemask": "(###)###-####"
}

*Language Created :*
POST : http://address-n02.test.ord1.us.ci.rackspace.net:8080/address/v1/admin/countries/ZZ/languages
Payload :

{
  "languageCode": "jj",
  "languageName": "jlanguage",
  "weightage": 30
}

*Country Deleted :*

DELETE : http://address-n02.test.ord1.us.ci.rackspace.net:8080/address/v1/admin/countries/ZZ

*Country Created again with same code*

*Language added with another name*

{
  "languageCode": "jj",
  "languageName": "jjlanguage",
  "weightage": 30
}

*Languages retrieved for country :*

GET : http://address-n02.test.ord1.us.ci.rackspace.net:8080/address/v1/admin/countries/ZZ/languages

Response with old language name : jlanguage
{
    "language": [
        {
            "languageCode": "jj",
            "languageName": "jlanguage",
            "weightage": 30
        }
    ]
}
column582: 11/May/22 2:15 AM - UTC;60a2cfd5dafdf000686f8814;[~accountid:60a2d03b2614ec0068ae8bf5] - This is correct functionality. Please check.

h2. Requirements
 * Merge tests from AddressService-staging to master
 * Run production smoke test suite in production
 ** https://customer.jenkins.cit.rackspace.net/job/AddressService-Integration-Tests-PRODUCTION/
 ** Specify "Production" as the TAGS parameter (default value of job)
OPS: Production Deployment
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters

h2. Production

{code:java}apps='addres' 
tier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=dfw1
flyway_ver='1.0.4'
commit=cc51704bf96b3f07fa61094a7056e9651b67ea73
rollback_commit=8af73a08a3b4d6e9cd119552ed66f76d499fe053{code}

h1. Deployment Steps

# On *customer-001.$\{toolbox_dc}.$\{toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
# Create your deploy environment.
{code:java}mkdir ADS-229
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-address.git
cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $commit
cd ..{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#ff0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}

# Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code:java}mkdir address-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/address/address-service-db/${flyway_ver}/address-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip address-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip{code}
# Execute flyway script against proper database
{code:java}AddressServiceDB/bin/address_service_flyway.sh -m -u address_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/address?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"{code}
(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code:java}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
#* If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
#** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1976|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1976]
#** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1973|https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/1973]
# back out one directory
{code:java}cd ../
{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes

# Run the deploy playbook.
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:puppetmasters3{code}

h1. Rollback Steps

# Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code:java}cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $rollback_commit{code}
# Re-execute playbook
{code:java}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'{code}

column607: Populate iso data to address db
Update address service application to implement language weightage criteria

column1: Determine the Romanization system to go with for languages with multiple romanization systems.
column33:
Determine the Romanization system to go with for languages with multiple romanization systems.

Language names:

RU,--- 

KO

KM,

AR

BE

address=# select distinct romanization_system from iso_subdivision_names where language = 'ru';
romanization_system
--------------------------
GOST 1983 = UN V/18 1987
BGN/PCGN 1947
(2 rows)



address=# select distinct romanization_system from iso_subdivision_names where language = 'ar';
romanization_system
---------------------
conventional names
BGN/PCGN 1956
(2 rows)

Romanization system available for each language code.

address=# select distinct romanization_system from iso_subdivision_names where language = 'km';
romanization_system
---------------------
National draft 1997
BGN/PCGN 1972
(2 rows)



address=# select distinct romanization_system from iso_subdivision_names where language = 'ko';
romanization_system
------------------------
KPS 11080:2002
McCune-Reischauer 1939
National 2000
(3 rows)



address=# select distinct romanization_system from iso_subdivision_names where language = 'be';
romanization_system
---------------------
UN X/6 2012
BGN/PCGN 1979
column582:
31/Mar/22 2:13 PM - UTC;60a2bed99fd9f30067937c7a;Based on the discussions/research on romanization with [~accountid:60a2bf1b2614ec0068ad7a79] [~accountid:60a2c2f65998a600684d9583]  below has been finalized:

* Language RU - use UN based “GOST 1983 = UN V/18 1987” when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided
* Language AR - use “BGN/PCGN 1956” when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided
* Language KM - use “BGN/PCGN 1972”
* Language KO - use “KPS 11080:2002” when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided
* Language BE - use “UN X/6 2012 when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided

service puppet stop
ps -ef | grep pup
mv /etc/puppet/ /etc/puppet2
mv /var/lib/puppet /var/lib/puppet2
yum localinstall facter-2.4.6-1.el6.x86_64.rpm hiera-1.3.4-1.el6.noarch.rpm puppet-3.8.7-1.el6.noarch.rpm
yum install splunkforwarder
vi /etc/puppet/puppet.conf
# Set server and environment = address
puppet agent -t --noop
# (go sign the cert)
su - splunk
# (as splunk) /opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk start --accept-license --answer-yes (make a random 8 char pass to make it happy)
# /opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk stop
# exit to root
puppet agent -t{noformat}

# Make one state code as inactive. When /v1/countries/UU is called, only the active states are displayed.
# Make one state code as inactive. When /v1/countries/UU?activeStatesOnly=false is called, then all the states are displayed (both active and inactive)
# Make one state code as inactive. When /v1/countries/UU?activeStatesOnly=false&includeAllLanguages=true is called, then all the states are displayed (both active and inactive) with all the languages
# When /v1/countries/UU is called with no default language for the state_code - then by default highest weightage language is displayed.
# Update the default language to some other language which is not highest weightage language. When /v1/countries/UU is called, then the entry with the default language is displayed in the response.

column33:
Make appropriate changes to admin API’s as stated below :

Currently we have below existing Admin APIs.

+*EXISTING APIS*+

* POST /admin/countries
* GET /admin/countries
* GET /admin/countries/\{countryCode}
* PUT /admin/countries/\{countryCode}
* DELETE /admin/countries/\{countryCode}



* POST /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/states
* GET /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/\{stateCode}
* PUT /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/\{stateCode}
* DELETE /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/\{stateCode}

The APIs need to be added / modified as mentioned below

+*NEW APIS*+

* POST /admin/countries
* GET /admin/countries
* GET /admin/countries/\{countryCode}
* PUT /admin/countries/\{countryCode}
* DELETE /admin/countries/\{countryCode}

(no change in the countries APIs)

* GET /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/languages
* POST /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/languages
* PUT /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/languages/\{languageCode}

(languages APIs are newly added, the payloads are mentioned in the comments section) - Country level language maintenance API's (including update language weightage at country level)

* POST /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/state_codes
** Should be able to create state code along with list of states (state name & language) 
* GET /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/state_codes/\{stateCode}
** Should return the state code information and its states \[admin apis will list all states with no filter]
* PUT /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/state_codes/\{stateCode}
** Should update only the state code information but not states information directly.
*** Place type name/default language - State code only
*** Status - 
**** If we try to set state code inactive then set all state names inactive as well.
* DELETE /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/state_codes/\{stateCode}
** Deleting a state code should delete state code and its states.
* POST /v1/admin/countries/\{countryCode}/state_codes/\{stateCode}/states
** To create a state  (state name & language)
** If we try to set any of the state name active, then it should make state code also active.
* PUT /v1/admin/countries/\{countryCode}/state_codes/\{stateCode}/states/\{stateId}
** To update the state parameters
** If we try to set any of the state name active, then it should make state code also active.



+*Other requirements*+

* Add/Update state/code admin APIs should validate below
** Make sure the language is provided in the request and it is available in country level weightage list
* Update active flags at both state code and state name/language level
* state code can be turned off by setting it to inactive or by turning off the last state under it
* and can be turned back on, only by turning on, one of the underlying states



The response for /v1/admin/countries/\{countryCode} is to be updated.



{noformat}{
  "stateCodes": {
    "stateCode": [
      {
        "code": "AB",
        "type": "province",
        "isActive": true,
        "defaultLanguage": null,
        "parentStateCode": "XX",
        "states": {
          "state": [
            {
              "name": "Alberta",
              "isActive": true,
              "languageCode": "fr"
            },
            {
              "name": "Alberta",
              "isActive": true,
              "languageCode": "en"
            }
          ]
        }
      },
      {
        "code": "BC",
        "type": "province",
        "isActive": true,
        "defaultLanguage": null,
        "states": {
          "state": [
            {
              "name": "Colombie-Britannique",
              "isActive": true,
              "languageCode": "fr"
            },
            {
              "name": "British Columbia",
              "isActive": true,
              "languageCode": "en"
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  "code": "CA",
  "name": "CANADA",
  "phonemask": "(###) ###-#### x##########",
  "hasZipCode": true,
  "type": "Country"
}{noformat}

Changes to be made (10 May 2022):

*New APIs for managing languages :* 

POST /admin/languages

PUT /admin/languages

\{

“name” : “language1”

“code” : “l1

}

For APIs : 

* POST /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/languages
* PUT /admin/countries/\{countryCode}/languages/\{languageCode}

The language should not be created/updated. The payload for these operation *should only include language code and weightage*.



+*13th May 2022 - Discussion*+

Below is the update on the active flags for state code and state.

+*Create State Code Operation*+

Scenario 1 : 

* The State Code is Inactive. And the underlying states are Active
* We need to validate the payload and throw Bad Request Exception

Scenario 2 :

* The State Code is Inactive. And the underlying states are Inactive
* So, its being created that way, its a valid request

Scenario 3 :

* The State Code is Active. And all the underlying states are Inactive
* We need to validate the payload and throw Bad Request Exception

Scenario 4 :

* The State Code is Active. And all the underlying states are Active
* Valid Request

Scenario 5 :

* The State Code is Active. And Some states are active, and some are inactive.
* Valid Request

+*Update State Code Operation*+

Scenario 1 :

* Update the State Code is Inactive
* All states should become inactive

Scenario 2 :

* Update the State Code is Active
* Cannot perform this operation

+*Create State Operation*+

Scenario 1 :

* The State Code is Inactive, State is active
* Turn the state code to Active if its Inactive

Scenario 2 :

* The State Code is Inactive, State is inactive
* Valid Request

Scenario 3:

* The State Code is Active, State is inactive
* Valid Request

Scenario 4:

* The State Code is Active, State is Active
* Valid Request

+*Update State Operation*+

Scenario 1 :

* The State Code is Inactive, Existing state is inactive, making the State to active
* Turn the state code to Active

Scenario 2 :

* The State Code is Inactive, State is active, making the state to inactive
* Not Valid Scenario

Scenario 3:

* The State Code is Active, State is inactive, making the state to active
* Valid Request

Scenario 4:

* The State Code is Active, State is active, making the state to inactive, other states are active
* Valid Request

Scenario 5

* The State Code is Active, State is active, making the state to inactive, other states are not active
* Make the state code to inactive

+*20 May 2022*+

Below additional changes to be made

* Cannot create state code without states
* When parent state code is not found, its bad request
* Cannot update language of the state

* Lets say we have a country named “UU” and it has language mapped \[ languageCode = hi, languageName = Hindi, weightage = 90]
* Now Create another country name “VV” and add a new language weightage to it. \[ Language Code = “hi”, languageName = “Hindi Updated”, weightage = 80]
* Now, whenever we add a new language weightage to a country with the existing language, if we give a new language name - does that need to be updated ? (because it would update the language name for the first country as well)

+*Question 2 :*+

* With the API “ PUT /v1/admin/\{countryCode}/languages/\{languageCode}” - do we need to update only the weightage value or can we also update the language name ?
* Here the same question arises, if we update language name - it would update the language name for the existing country as well

column1: Update address service application to implement language weightage criteria
column33:
*Application:*

* Table country_language_weightage will guide in prioritizing the languages for each state code in order to select one for default response (with highest weightage available), unless overridden by default language for state code.
* Either default or high weightage will need to be active in order to be in response unless explicitly queried
* If default language is not active, revert back to country level weightage

*DB Changes:*

* States Table Changes
** Remove state_code column
** Remove parent_state_id column
** Remove country_id column
** Remove language_code column
** Add language_id with foreign key reference
** Move place_type_name to state_codes table
** Drop idx_states_country_id index
** Update unique index uq_states_index with combination for state_code_id and language_id
* State Codes Table Changes
** Add place_type_name column
** Add is_active column
** Add default_language_id foreign key referencing languages(language_id)
* New Table Country Language weightage (country_language_weightage)
** country_language_weightage_id integer primary key not null
** country_id integer not null foreign key
** language_id integer not null foreign key referencing languages(language_id)
** weightage integer not null
** Unique constraint on country_id, weightage
** Unique constraint on country_id, language_id
* New Table Languages (languages)
** language_id integer primary key not null
** language_code varchar(2) not null
** Language_name varchar(50)
** Unique constraint on language_code





*NOTE:* 

* Columns marked as “removed” will not be removed from DB but the usage will have to be deprecated. And any constraints on these columns should be removed.
* Unique constraints will be added as part ADS-148
* QE will depend on the completion of ADS-148
column117:
# Schema changes done
# Get States by country should follow below criteria
## If a state has default language display that in response if it is Active
## If a state does not have default language display as per country level weightage in response if it is Active
## If a state has default language but it is not active then find highest weighted language code as per country level which is active.
# Query Param “activeStatesOnly=false“ (default true) - If Get States by country requested with Query Param to show inactive states, ignore checking state status (Active/Inactive) and remaining above logic (specified in point 2) applied.
# /v1/countries/AF?activeStatesOnly=true&includeAllLanguages=true
# Query Param “includeAllLanguages=true“ (default false) - In this case, just return all active states unless active state filter is also queried.
# QE will test with correct data populated as part of [https://rackspace.atlassian.net/browse/ADS-148|https://rackspace.atlassian.net/browse/ADS-148|smart-link]

activeStatesOnly filter is for state_codes table.

column33:
Compute the language weightage based on below criteria:

Highest weightage(100) will always be assigned to English for any country regardless of whether country has language code or not.

Count language repetition within a country and assign weightage in descending order with count, and alphabetical order to break tied counts.



sample:

* EN - 100
* FR - 95
* ES - 90



Output csv should have “country code”, “language code”, “weightage”.

Prepare a script to read the iso csv files and compute language weightage.



Refer the iso file attached to epic [https://rackspace.atlassian.net/browse/ADS-184|https://rackspace.atlassian.net/browse/ADS-184|smart-link]
column117: * output csv with correct weightage language code assigned

column33:
Address Service Db Refresh
Data in Address service db is outdated and hasn’t been refreshed in a long time. And this was causing account creation failures between Signup and Salesforce as the country states combination in Address service db (which Signup calls) is not the same as in SF. To fix this problem , we need to refresh the data with most current data from iso.org .
column582:
24/Feb/22 6:32 PM - UTC;60a2bed99fd9f30067937c7a;*Meeting minutes*:

 

Each country has more than one language code and Address service db today has one code as active. Data dump from [http://iso.org|http://iso.org|smart-link]  has more than one language codes for each state and we need to figure out a way to update this in system. Per the discussion with Bryan, the decision was to see if could be in sync with iso and return all the language codes for each state instead of  just one.

 

*Next steps:* We agreed to first  figure out who is calling Address doctor countries end point today and then reach out to them to see if returning more than one state as active in the result set would break anything on their end.

[@Karteek Kanneganti|mailto:Karteek.Kanneganti@rackspace.com] /[@Senthil Natarajan|mailto:Senthil.Natarajan@rackspace.com] to check the logs and trace the ips calling this endpoint and go from there.

column607: Investigate Repose logging on Address Service to identify consumers .

column1: Investigate Repose logging on Address Service to identify consumers .
column33: *Background*- Per Cory, the server logs today does not tell who is hitting the address service endpoints as the service is behind a Loadbalancer. This investigation is to see what type of logging is in place with Address service so we can improve it to identify consumers by logging the source ip addresses .
column117: * Create a story with required logging changes that will allow us to identify the consumers and traces all the incoming requests.
column582: 08/Feb/22 4:52 PM - UTC;60a2bed99fd9f30067937c7a; [~accountid:60a2ba5920ad1b007047190c]  checked the logs and was not able to trace back the ips hitting address service endpoints as the service was behind load balancer. Will close this and create a new story for adding logging in repose.

column1: There are currently two broken links within the Privacy Statement found at: https://www.rackspace.com/information/legal/privacystatement
column33:
Under the paragraph "How We Use Tracking Technologies", there are two links at the bottom of the second paragraph "please click here or here."   Those links are broken.

For the first "here" the link should be:  https://optout.networkadvertising.org/?c=1
For the second "here" the link should be:  https://youradchoices.com/control

These broken links have been subject to our APEC audit, so they need to be repaired quickly.  Please let me know if you have any questions, or need any additional information.

h2. Requirements
 * Merge tests from AddressService-staging to master
 * Run production smoke test suite in production
 ** https://customer.jenkins.cit.rackspace.net/job/AddressService-Integration-Tests-PRODUCTION/
 ** Specify "Production" as the TAGS parameter (default value of job)

h1. Environment-specific parameters

h2. Staging

{code:java}apps='address' 
tier=prod{code}

h1. Predeployment

# Clear address-n0* certs from puppetmaster

{noformat}puppet cert clean address-n01.prod.dfw1.us.ci.rackspace.net
puppet cert clean address-n02.prod.dfw1.us.ci.rackspace.net{noformat}

h1. Deployment Steps

# On *customer-001.$\{toolbox_dc}.$\{toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
# Create your deploy environment.
{code:java}mkdir ADS-162
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes

# Update repose

{noformat}# node 1 - install
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-a -m shell -a "plight disable; sed -i 's/enabled=1/enabled=0/' /etc/yum.repos.d/jpackage-6.0-generic.repo; service repose-valve stop && yum versionlock clear && yum clean all; yum update -y repose* --nogpgcheck; rm -rf /var/lib/puppet/ssl; puppet agent -t && service repose-valve start"
# node 1 - enable
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-a -m shell -a "plight enable"

# node 2 - install
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-b -m shell -a "plight disable; sed -i 's/enabled=1/enabled=0/' /etc/yum.repos.d/jpackage-6.0-generic.repo; service repose-valve stop && yum versionlock clear && yum clean all; yum update -y repose* --nogpgcheck; rm -rf /var/lib/puppet/ssl; puppet agent -t && service repose-valve start"
# node 2 - enable
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-b -m shell -a "plight enable"{noformat}
# Wait for Karteek to run API script on address
# Restart Signup app to clear cache

{noformat}# node set A - restart app
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} signup-${tier}nodes-a -m shell -a "plight disable; service tomcat7 restart;sleep 30; plight enable"

# node set B - restart app
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} signup-${tier}nodes-b -m shell -a "plight disable; service tomcat7 restart;sleep 30; plight enable"{noformat}

h2. Rollback steps

# Rollback repose

{noformat}# node 1 - downgrade
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-a -m shell -a "plight disable; service repose-valve stop && yum versionlock clear && yum clean all; yum downgrade -y repose-valve-7.1.7.1 repose-filter-bundle-7.1.7.1 repose-extensions-filter-bundle-7.1.7.1 --nogpgcheck; puppet agent -t && service repose-valve start"
# node 1 - enable
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-a -m shell -a "plight enable"

# node 2 - downgrade
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-b -m shell -a "plight disable; service repose-valve stop && yum versionlock clear && yum clean all; yum downgrade -y repose-valve-7.1.7.1 repose-filter-bundle-7.1.7.1 repose-extensions-filter-bundle-7.1.7.1 --nogpgcheck; puppet agent -t && service repose-valve start"
# node 2 - enable
/usr/bin/ansible -Kkb -i ansible-hosts/${tier} address-${tier}-nodes-b -m shell -a "plight enable"{noformat}
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters
h2. Production
{code}apps='customer-prod-dr:customer-admin-prod-dr:customer-repose-prod-dr' tier=prodtier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=dfw1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_NEW
rollback_commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_CURRENT
{code}
h1. Deployment Steps
 # On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
 # Create your deploy environment.
{code}mkdir CUST-XXXXX
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-customer.git
cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $commit
cd ..
{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#FF0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}
 # Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
{code}
 # Execute flyway script against proper database
{code}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"
{code}
{quote}(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2
{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
{quote}
 ** If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
 *** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
 *** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
 # remove flyway scripts
{code}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db
{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes
 # Run the deploy playbook.
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3
{code}

h1. Rollback Steps
 # Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit
{code}
 # Re-execute playbook
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3
{code}

rollback_commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_CURRENT
{code}
h1. Deployment Steps
 # On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
 # Create your deploy environment.
{code}mkdir CUST-XXXXX
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-customer.git
cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $commit
cd ..
{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#FF0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}
 # Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
{code}
 # Execute flyway script against proper database
{code}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"
{code}
{quote}(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2
{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
{quote}
 ** If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
 *** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
 *** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
 # remove flyway scripts
{code}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db
{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes
 # Run the deploy playbook.
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet-before-reboot=false'
{code}

h1. Rollback Steps
 # Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit
{code}
 # Re-execute playbook
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3 -e 'reboot=false puppet-before-reboot=false'
{code}

column590:
30/Mar/22 7:33 PM - UTC;60a2c2f65998a600684d9583;Based on some research we have decided to use below criteria ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanization|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanization|smart-link] ):

* Language RU - use UN based “GOST 1983 = UN V/18 1987” when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided
* Language AR - use “BGN/PCGN 1956” when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided
* Language KM - use “BGN/PCGN 1972”
* Language KO - use “KPS 11080:2002” when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided
* Language BE - use “UN X/6 2012 when multiple exists, otherwise use whatever provided

column593:
24/Feb/22 6:32 PM - UTC;60a2bed99fd9f30067937c7a;Meeting notes: 1.6.2022

*Meeting minutes*:

 Each country has more than one language code and Address service db today has one code as active. Data dump from [http://iso.org|http://iso.org|smart-link]  has more than one language codes for each state and we need to figure out a way to update this in system. Per the discussion with Bryan, the decision was to see if could be in sync with iso and return all the language codes for each state instead of  just one.

 

*Next steps:* We agreed to first  figure out who is calling Address doctor countries end point today and then reach out to them to see if returning more than one state as active in the result set would break anything on their end.

[@Karteek Kanneganti|mailto:Karteek.Kanneganti@rackspace.com] /[@Senthil Natarajan|mailto:Senthil.Natarajan@rackspace.com] to check the logs and trace the ips calling this endpoint and go from there.

column33:
Hi Team, 

Our customer has requested that they have specific emails be customized to NOT be received during the hours of 10 pm - 8 am (CDT). While I understand this is a specific ask, I wanted to share the specific details for each of the emails they want to see customizations to:

 
 # 
h3. +Alerts - Sent over to review / Place JIRA +

 # 
h3. {color:#000000}Subject: Linux Patch Availability Notification{color}{color:#000000} - {color}[210202-01579|https://my.rackspace.com/portal/ticket/detail/210202-01579]

 # 
h3. {color:#000000}Do not send between 10 pm - 8 am (CDT) - Delayed {color}

h3.  
 # 
h3. {color:#000000}Subject :DFW101CS0001: MBU Autofailure:1108736{color}{color:#000000} - {color}[210128-02664|https://my.rackspace.com/portal/ticket/detail/210128-02664]

 # 
h3. {color:#000000}Do not want to receive emails for this at all {color}

 # 
h3. {color:#000000}MBU to make it privately generate until communication is needed for immediate assistance {color}


 # 
h3. MBU get them involved 

h3.  
 # 
h3. New Suppression Request has been received for Device(s) - Email 

 # 
h3. No notifications

With the details above, please let me know what questions you have and/or what I need to ask the customer to fulfill the request. I tried adding the email attachments but they did not attach. 

 

Thank you, 

Jenn Soliz

column582:
29/Jan/21 3:52 PM - UTC;60a2ce2f2614ec0068ae6cda;

From: "Cone, Marquis" <mcone@informatica.com>
Date: Friday, January 29, 2021 at 9:12 AM
To: Seshagiri Bandila <seshagiri.bandila@rackspace.com>, Anitha Sajja <anitha.sajja@rackspace.com>
Cc: Pradaman Shorey <pradaman.shorey@rackspace.com>, Krishna Mohan Prativadi Bhayamkaram <krishnamohanprativadi.bhayamkaram@rackspace.com>, Peda Triumalaiah Bhonagiri <pedatriumalaiah.bhonagiri@rackspace.com>, Glenn Royal <Glenn.Royal@rackspace.com>, Annie Flores <Annie.Flores@rackspace.com>, Karteek Kanneganti <Karteek.Kanneganti@rackspace.com>, Senthil Natarajan <Senthil.Natarajan@rackspace.com>
Subject: RE: Address Doctor End Point URL update needed.

CAUTION: This message originated externally, please use caution when clicking on links or opening attachments!

Hello All,
 
Here is the response I received below regarding your question:
 
 
Hi
 
Please check if you have replaced more than just the URL in the request.
 
The correct endpoint is:
https://validator5.addressdoctor.com/webservice5/v4/addressvalidation.asmx
The URL is replaced to https.
 
Please make sure that the NAMESPACE (inside the SOAP request) still reads:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:v4="http://validator5.AddressDoctor.com/Webservice5/v4">
 
If you accidentially changed "http" to "https" in this line, then you invalidated the request. 
This is no URL but an identifier.
 
Regards
 
Marquis Cone  |  Client Renewals
15501 Weston Parkway, Cary, NC 27513
Office: +1.910 635 2303
Email: mcone@informatica.com
 
 
 
 
From: Seshagiri Bandila <seshagiri.bandila@rackspace.com> 
Sent: Thursday, January 28, 2021 12:48 PM
To: Cone, Marquis <mcone@informatica.com>; Anitha Sajja <anitha.sajja@rackspace.com>
Cc: Pradaman Shorey <pradaman.shorey@rackspace.com>; Krishna Mohan Prativadi Bhayamkaram <krishnamohanprativadi.bhayamkaram@rackspace.com>; Peda Triumalaiah Bhonagiri <pedatriumalaiah.bhonagiri@rackspace.com>; Glenn Royal <Glenn.Royal@rackspace.com>; Annie Flores <Annie.Flores@rackspace.com>; Karteek Kanneganti <Karteek.Kanneganti@rackspace.com>; Senthil Natarajan <Senthil.Natarajan@rackspace.com>
