We have gone through Salesforce Health Check to identify and fix potential vulnerabilities in our Salesforce security settings. One of the important recommendation from them is “Require secure connections (HTTPS) for all third-party domains”. 
 
Currently, the end point URL for Address Doctor in our Salesforce system is “http://validator5.addressdoctor.com”.  Could you provide us the alternate secure end point URL for the Address Doctor app?
 
We want to validate it in our lower sandboxes and test our external systems(CMS) where address doctor is being used. 
 
Thanks,
Seshagiri.

column1: Churn forecasts are not generating cancellation tickets in CORE
column33:
Hi, in the cloud office team we have noticed that churn forecasts are not generating cancellation tickets as they should, resulting in us processing credits for those customers. I've attached an email chain below with Steve Hurley who looked into this for us and then suggested we create a service now ticket. SNOW then asked us to create a Jira ticket.

..............................

 

 

*From:* Steve Hurley <steve.hurley@rackspace.com> 
 *Sent:* 13 March 2020 14:41
 *To:* Lauren Campbell <Lauren.Campbell@rackspace.co.uk>
 *Cc:* Louise Dorkings <louise.dorkings@rackspace.co.uk>
 *Subject:* RE: Accounts that were due to be cancelled but no cancellation ticket was generated

 

Sorry for the delay, but I was combing through the CORE code to see what the issue(s) could be. 

 

In the screenshot of the queue you supplied, there’s actually two tickets for UK S1.  Comparing the ones that were created with the ones that were not created, I can’t see anything obvious that could cause tickets to not be created.  As far as I can tell, there’s a process that runs on the churn date to create the cancellation tickets – and everything I’ve seen looks like they should have been created, but there are some things I can’t see since I’m not on the CORE team.

 

One note: It actually creates the tickets in the “Cloud Office – Account Managers” queue and not the “Cloud Office – Cancellations” queue – they appear to be manually moved over after creation.

 

Some of the relevant code:

 

    def scheduleAccountLevelProductForCancellation(

        self, product_name, attributes, queue_id=None, prefab_label=None

    ):

        prefab = None

 

        if queue_id is None and (

            product_name == "Microsoft Exchange"

            or product_name == "Rackspace Email"

        ):

            if self.support_team.id in (Team.TEAM_S1, Team.TEAM_UKS1):

                queue_id = CTK.Ticket.Queue.Queue.MAILTRUST_ACCOUNT_MANAGERS

            elif self.type.name == "Intensive":

                queue_id = CTK.Ticket.Queue.Queue.INTENSIVE_ACCOUNT_MANAGEMENT

            else:

                # It will be either Managed or Intensive, if it's not intensive

                # then it should be Managed ( or defult will be Managed AM

                # queue)

                queue_id = CTK.Ticket.Queue.Queue.ACCOUNT_MANAGEMENT

 

        if prefab_label is None:

            prefab = Message.load(label="RS_Email_Cancel")

        else:

            prefab = Message.load(label=prefab_label)

 

 

At this point, you may want to create a SNOW ticket for TESONE and CORE to review the logs to see if they can glean any details on what could have happened.

 

Steve

 

*From:* Lauren Campbell <[Lauren.Campbell@rackspace.co.uk|mailto:Lauren.Campbell@rackspace.co.uk]> 
 *Sent:* Thursday, March 12, 2020 11:17 AM
 *To:* Steve Hurley <[steve.hurley@rackspace.com|mailto:steve.hurley@rackspace.com]>
 *Cc:* Louise Dorkings <[louise.dorkings@rackspace.co.uk|mailto:louise.dorkings@rackspace.co.uk]>
 *Subject:* FW: Accounts that were due to be cancelled but no cancellation ticket was generated

 

Hey Steve,

 

Thanks for looking into this us.

 

The below examples from Louise are all churn forecasts we created, that did not automatically generate a cancellation ticket.

 

Automatically generated tickets then get sent to the queue ‘cloud office – cancellations’ where the account is then closed down. You’ll see this queue doesn’t have any tickets from UKS1 in there which is our team, and I’m certain that there should be.

 

 

Thanks,

Lauren

column1: Stop pushing RPMs to puppet2 repository
column33: Stop pushing RPMs to puppet2 RPM repository.

details in: [https://one.rackspace.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=CUST&title=Migrating+from+Mosso+to+RSI%3AArtifacts]
 * review maven repo configs
 ** [https://github.rackspace.com/rsi/deploy-answers-artifactory/blob/master/answers/repos/maven.yml]
 * update maven xmls in jenkins configs
 ** [https://customer.jenkins.cit.rackspace.net/configfiles/]
 * update jenkinsfiles in repos
 ** withMaven/mavenSettingsConfig
 ** secondary mosso mvn deploy - snapshot
 ** secondary mosso mvn deploy - release
 * update POMs in repos
 ** replace mosso repositories with artifactory repositories
 *** repositories/repository
 *** pluginRepositories/pluginRepository
 *** distributionManagement/repository
 *** distributionManagement/snapshotRepository
 ** update maven-deploy-plugin to 2.8 or higher

* verify rpm repo configs
 ** [https://github.rackspace.com/rsi/deploy-answers-artifactory/blob/master/answers/repos/rpm.yml]
 * update jenkinsfiles
 ** see customer-service Jenkinsfile
 * -update deploy-answers-address-
 ** -see deploy-answers-customer-
 * update -puppet-repo- puppet-profile_address
 ** see existing customer artifactory repos

When we release a new version of Address Service, we need to delete the snapshot RPM files that we uploaded to RSI:Artifacts during the development process. To do this, we need to add a cleanup step to the Jenkins job if the build is a release.

https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/customer-rpm-local/el/6/build/x86_64

column1: Version no longer included in healthcheck page
column33:
Previously we the docs/index.html endpoint used for our healthcheck page during deployment displayed the version. {code} address-service-contract - 1.5.7-SNAPSHOT - 2019-04-11

address-service-contract - 1.5.7-SNAPSHOT - 2019-04-11

Developer Guide

Address API Developer Guide

WADL

address.wadl
The Address API Developer Guide includes a detailed description of the service described in this wadl. Note that this raw version of the development wadl may include items that are not yet included in the developer guide and are not yet implemented

XSD

Note that this raw version of the xsd files may include items that are not yet used or implemented by the current service.
address.xsd ( html)
common.xsd ( html)
atom/atom-v1.0.xsd ( html)
atom/xml.xsd ( html)

Contract Release Log
{code} https://github.rackspace.com/customer-signup/address-service/blob/master/address-service-contract/src/main/filteredwebapp/index.html The changes in 1.5.6-release removed this page and replaced it with a more generic page: {code} Address Service

This page exists so that the operations team know that Address Service is alive.

{code} The deploy playbooks, however, are looking specifically for the word "version" when determining whether the healthcheck is passing or not. https://github.rackspace.com/cloud-integration-ops/ansible-playbooks/blob/master/deploy_address.yml#L69 {code} - name: check for HTTP response from URL command: /usr/bin/curl --max-time 60 -sk {{ app_url }} register: result until: result.stdout.find("version") != -1 retries: 180 delay: 10 tags: common-healthcheck {code} Additionally, the version on this page is the only way for QE to validate the proper version was deployed when there are no API changes in a release. Branch Used: https://github.rackspace.com/customer-signup/address-service/tree/Release_1.5.7_6

column33:
Below changes are not merged to master. So these changes are not released to prod.

Need to test these changes and prepare for ADS 1.5.8 release.
 * [1.5.6-release|https://github.rackspace.com/customer-signup/address-service/tree/1.5.6-release]
 ** ADS-51 - It is tagged to 1.5.7, but the code changes are in this branch only.
 *** Upgrade ADS to Java8
 *** Upgrade to Spring 4
 *** Jenkinsfile changes 
 ** Cleanup
 *** Consolidated the address-service projects and cleaned up the dependencies.
 *** Moved the XSDs out of the contract project and into the war project.
 * [Release_1.5.7|https://github.rackspace.com/customer-signup/address-service/tree/Release_1.5.7]
 ** ADS-64 : Add redirect to Address Service API documentation
 ** Artifactory Changes
 *** TEA-1346: Maven Repo Migration (Address)
 *** TEA-1348: RPM Repo Migration (Address)
 *** TEA-1902: Stop pushing RPMs to puppet2 - Address ( Open PR - [https://github.rackspace.com/customer-signup/address-service/pull/212])

*Notes:*
 * Latest release tag  - [address-service-1.5.6|https://github.rackspace.com/customer-signup/address-service/tree/address-service-1.5.6]
 * Last code release - TESENG-1689 - 1.5.5 on 05/Mar/18 [Release notes|https://one.rackspace.com/display/CUST/Address+1.5.0]
 * From 1.5.0 to 1.5.6 has only Jenkinfile Changes and Test Release cuts
 * Older versions are not available in mosso ([http://maven.mosso.com/content/repositories/mosso-releases/com/rackspace/address/service/]) and artifacts ([https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/address/service/address-service])
 ** Verify and upload last release version for rollback
 * Generate and deploy 1.5.5 RPM to Maven Mosso for Rollback.

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Check that all existing functionality is as-is after the code migration
 * NO changes to existing API's
 * Co-ordinate with Ops on Rollback strategy.

h2. Requirements
 * Merge tests from CMS-staging to master
 * Run production smoke test suite in production
 ** [https://customer.jenkins.cit.rackspace.net/job/CMS-Integration-Tests-PRODUCTION/]
 ** Specify "Production" as the TAGS parameter (default value of job)
OPS: Production Deployment
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters
h2. Production
{code}apps='address-prod' 
tier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=dfw1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=1ee72586c851a387d4ebe185f95cbfecd688a3e8
rollback_commit=ae6c2430c135865124d4444ba1beeae32c66aae1
{code}
h1. Deployment Steps
 # On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
 # Create your deploy environment.
{code}mkdir ADS-91
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-address.git
cd deploy-answers-address
git checkout $commit
cd ..
{code}
h2. Database changes

{color:#FF0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}
 # Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
{code}
 # Execute flyway script against proper database
{code}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"
{code}
{quote}(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2
{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
{quote}
 ** If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
 *** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
 *** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
 # remove flyway scripts
{code}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db
{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes
 # Run the deploy playbook.
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:puppetmasters3:puppetmasters2-${tier}-us -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'
{code}

h1. Rollback Steps
 # Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit
{code}
 # Re-execute playbook
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-address/address-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_address.yml -l ${apps}:puppetmasters3:puppetmasters2-${tier}-us -e 'reboot=false puppet_before_reboot=false system_patch=false'
{code}

OPS: Production Deployment
column216:
h1. Environment-specific parameters
h2. Production
{code}apps='customer-prod-dr:customer-admin-prod-dr:customer-repose-prod-dr' tier=prodtier=prod
toolbox_tier=prod
toolbox_dc=ord1
dc=dfw1
flyway_ver='VER'
commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_NEW
rollback_commit=DEPLOY_ANSWERS_HASH_CURRENT
{code}
h1. Deployment Steps
 # On *customer-001.${toolbox_dc}.${toolbox_tier}.toolbox.rackspace.net* setup environment variables from above based upon tier you are deploying to
 # Create your deploy environment.
{code}mkdir CUST-XXXXX
cd !$
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/ansible-hosts.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cory2388/ansible-playbooks.git
git clone git@github.rackspace.com:cloud-integration-ops/deploy-answers-customer.git
cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $commit
cd ..
{code}

h2. Database changes

{color:#FF0000}*There may not be any database changes, in which case you can skip this section.*{color}
 # Retrieve flyway script and schema (you'll still have to do this on bastion as unzip package doesn't exist on toolbox)
{code}mkdir customer-db
cd !$
wget https://artifacts.rackspace.net/artifactory/list/customer-maven-local/com/rackspace/customer/customer-service-db/${flyway_ver}/customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
unzip customer-service-db-${flyway_ver}-java-app.zip
{code}
 # Execute flyway script against proper database
{code}CustomerServiceDB/bin/customer_service_flyway.sh -m -u customer_super_svc -p -url "jdbc:postgresql://customer-db.${tier}.${dc}.us.ci.rackspace.net:5432/customer?ssl=true&sslfactory=org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory"
{code}
{quote}(i) All steps executed will be displayed to screen. As long as no errors are encountered, the operation was successful. Last lines will be similar to:
{code}17:39:51.587 [main] INFO  o.f.core.internal.command.DbMigrate - Successfully applied 2 migrations to schema "public" (execution time 00:00.124s).
17:39:51.589 [main] INFO  com.rackspace.flyway.util.FlywayUtil - Number of migrations completed: 2
{code}
(i) In flyway, "Migrations" implies the changes were applied. Think 'migrated' from previous schema version to the new version.
{quote}
 ** If you don't have a personal user, you'll want to use the super service account from either:
 *** Prod: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2213]
 *** Staging: [https://passwordsafe.corp.rackspace.com/projects/2542]
 # remove flyway scripts
{code}cd ../
rm -rf customer-db
{code}

h2. Deploy app to nodes
 # Run the deploy playbook.
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3
{code}

h1. Rollback Steps
 # Rollback to previous deploy commit hash
{code}cd deploy-answers-customer
git checkout $rollback_commit
{code}
 # Re-execute playbook
{code}ansible-playbook -kK -i ansible-hosts/${tier} -e '@deploy-answers-customer/customer-answers.yml' ansible-playbooks/deploy_customer.yml -l ${apps}:repo-servers-${tier}-${dc}:puppetmasters3
{code}

column1: Wrap address prevalidation in a feature flag
column33:
As ADS I want a pre validation to be wrapped in a feature flag so that I can turn it off and on as needed by business.

Sometimes GB has different states in preval than exist in Address Doctor.
If a new sate isn't in preval the call will fail. Address Doctor will have the new state though.
We get in to a catch-22 where we cannot update the address.

Acceptance Criteria:

* Address Prevalidation logic is wrapped in a feature flag in Address services and Customer if it's there as well
* Feature flag is set in properties (requires puppet change and full deploy to environments as no-code deploy)
* There is a Feature Flag for Customer and for Address
* Feature flag is released OFF
* Feature flag ON enables against our state and country table.
* Feature flag OFF does not validate against our state and country table.
* Document
* Regression is updated to reflect the feature flag for pre validation

column1: Review the state of Address Service
column33:
The CMS/SU/ADS Team has bug fixes that need to get pushed out to production however the application has not been deployed to in 2 years!  This spike is to dust off the cobwebs and get Address Service up to par.

*Acceptance Criteria*
* Check Puppet/repose configs
* Deploy via the Ansible play books
* Review (find?) any regression/testing suites/plans for address service
* Manually hit the API as needed (see testing suite) and verify the application is working
* Run CMS/SU regression to hit ADS
* Create new stories/defects to address gaps as needed

*Timebox*
1 dev 3d
1 qe 2d

column1: Migrate Address Service Release builds to new Jenkins
column33:
As CMS Team we want to use our new Jenkins server for building all Address Service releases so that we can retire the INova instance

*Acceptance Criteria*
* Service Account is used to create release builds
* Tags are created in GitHub for new release
* Artifact versions are updated after a successful release build
* Artifacts are published to the current mosso release repositories
* WebHooks to old INova Jenkins are disabled
* Old INova Jenkins jobs are disabled

*Approach*
* Apply branch protection to the master branch
* When the pr is approved and merged then Jenkins should handle the release build
* Jenkinsfile will need to be modified to account for the master branch builds

Projects: address-service-release

column582:
21/Sep/17 9:36 PM - UTC;557058:7791fe5c-675f-42ff-8818-7aaffcf5cf0a;Old Jenkins job will not cut the release at all.

Job runs until it attempts to create a release tag, at this point Jenkins switches to the parent directory of the checked out project and attempts to run the 'git tag' command. Because the working directory is now no longer a git directory the tagging fails the release is unable to complete. 

No idea why this happens only on this job as the other release jobs are the exact same and do not have this issue. Currenlty have a pr out for the Jenkinsfile to perform the release job and am waiting on approval.

column1: Add more examples for Address Service validations/suggestions
column33:
As Address Service Consumers (cms-devs) we want better documentation around Address Service so that our consumers have help using address service.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
* Address service documentation now includes a "statecode" validation/suggestion payload example. 
** E.g.
** {"street":"340 Treeline Park","city":"San Antonio","*statecode*":"TX","country":"US","zipcode":"78209"}
** Add example to documentation
* Advertise case sensitivity and other nuances of the API
* Version numbers are on API docs
* Update Glossary as it is now blank\

1 dev 2 days

column1: Update Great Britain states in Address Service
column33:
Address Service has it's own listing of states and countries that haven't been updated in a while.  Given the recent influx of UK accounts we're seeing a high number of issues updating contacts with address that have States not in our system.

Review https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:GB and compare it to what we have in https://address.prod.dfw1.us.ci.rackspace.net/v1/countries/GB.  Add any state that's present in the ISO standard but missing in our system.  Report back to Kari and Josh

*Acceptance Criteria*
* States in https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:GB that are not found in Address Service are added
* Report back to Kari and Josh with the number of states added and the number of states that we have in our system that are not part of the ISO page.
column55: Took a while to script pulling the values dow from both our system and ISO.  Even longer to get them all in and cross reference what we have, not all values are available from the API...;20/Apr/17 8:10 PM - UTC;rk:7999fc30-0002-4917-960a-ddaa65bbb024;21600
